comments:

Hi Holger - I'm afraid I can't reproduce this problem.  Do you happen to remember what you were doing when it occurred?  Also a small test project would be really helpful if you can provide one.  Thanks.

I did not really do anything special except for simply using the UpdateManager to install a new AJDT release from http://download.eclipse.org/technology/ajdt/32/dev/update

Since this happens repeatably with various workspaces I am not entirely sure what to do differently? I don't think this is a conflict between plugins. Any project with AspectJ nature should show this since the inability to open the AspectJ editor was repeatable and not related to a particular project. I will try again with the latest release, a fresh workspace and a fresh project even though I don't think that it will make a difference.

The original motivation for the update was to get a bugfix in the compiler, but I realized that AJDT and the compiler are only synced periodically so I stick with the setup that I have now, which works reasonably well.

OK I just tried again in an empty, new workspace. Updated to the latest nightly AJDT, restart, create a new AspectJ project, create an Aspect, open it -> same CCE. Interestingly enough the source of AspectJEditor.java in 20060224163227 contains the same typecast as current CVS HEAD, so something else must be wrong.

Me again ;-)
I just tried a completely fresh 3.2M5a with the latest 3.2dev AJDT in a new workspace and now it works. Crazy since that was what i did when I moved to 3.2 as well, but apparently it seems my eclipse installation is somehow screwed. Certainly a first! I guess this issue can be closed. Sorry for the fuss.

This is definitely a problem - I have seen it a couple of times myself.  However I cannot reproduce it and I'm not keen to just add an instanceof guard because I think that would cause other problems with eager parsing and being able to delete files.  I have checked in a small change that may fix the problem, but since I can't test it I think it's probably worth keeping the bug report open for now.

just reproduced this myself upgrading from 1.4.0 20060131132251 to build 

Version: 1.4.0
Build id: 20060309045448
AspectJ version: 1.5.1.20060131132251

I'm appending my exception stack - probably redundant but might contain some subtle variation on the one already reported.

Restarting the workspace made this go away.

Returning this bug to the pool
see also bug 133703 for a similar looking ClassCastException
It doesn't look like this has been seen for some time, so it may now be fixed. Please reopen if you see it again with recent AJDT builds.
